definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself

pinyin: Bai3 you2 Jiao3 gen1 zhi1 zhou1

definition: to walk cautiously in order not to make noise

sentences.english: The PLA Air Force small test their skills in front of a firm footing.
sentences.chinese: 解放军空军小试身手，在前线站稳了脚跟。

sentences.english: It slides up and down my heel when I walk around.
sentences.chinese: 当我走动时，它就在我脚跟上下滑动。

sentences.english: RHT Reinforced Heel even as well even as Toe;
sentences.chinese: 脚尖和脚跟都有加厚层珍惜。
照马司模所言，那就是“我们要在这里站稳脚跟”。

sentences.english: I hankered after a floor-length brown suede coat.
sentences.chinese: 我渴望有一件长及脚跟的棕色绒面革大衣。

sentences.english: Continue to locomote using your heels only for two minutes.
sentences.chinese: 坚持用你的脚跟行走2分钟。

sentences.english: Then straightening upper body up, setting heel plane, lifting leg point.
sentences.chinese: 然后直起上身，放平脚跟，抬起腿尖。

sentences.english: Moisture-wicking suede footbed with arch support and cupped heel.
sentences.chinese: 排汗绒面鞋垫足弓支撑和巨脚跟。

sentences.english: The soldier clicked his heels and saluted.
sentences.chinese: 那个兵两脚跟咔嗒一声，立正敬礼。

sentences.english: It was so windy I could hardly keep my feet.
sentences.chinese: 风很大，我几乎站不稳脚跟。

sentences.english: Make sure each shinbone is exactly balancing over its heel.
sentences.chinese: 确保每个胫骨和它的对应的脚跟是平衡的。

sentences.english: I want some sticking plaster to put on my heel.
sentences.chinese: 我想用些橡皮膏贴在后脚跟上。

sentences.english: My knee is locked and my heel is striking the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我的膝盖锁死，正用脚跟着地。

sentences.english: Tiptoe to outside rotation, heel to close within.
sentences.chinese: 脚尖向外转动，脚跟向内靠紧。

sentences.english: A day a few years ago, she was standing in the river edge, heel falls road.
sentences.chinese: 几年前的一天，她站在忘川边缘，脚跟也跌路下去。

sentences.english: Keep them free from dry skin and cracked heels.
sentences.chinese: 使它们不受皮肤干燥和脚跟干裂的影响。

definition: variant of 腳跟|脚跟[jiao3 gen1]
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
to gain a firm foothold/(fig.) to get oneself established
to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
to feet the feet perfectly/to follow closely/hard on sb's heels
to stand/to have a footing/to be established/to base oneself on
knee/(Internet slang) to kneel down (in admiration)
